qas.question: Who can elect the members of the upper house?
Can the members of the upper house be elected directly or indirectly?
Can the members of the lower house be elected directly or indirectly?
Who can't elect the members of the upper house?
Who can elect the leaders of the upper house?
Can the members of the upper house be impeached directly or indirectly?
Can the members of the lower house be impeached directly or indirectly?
Can the citizens of the lower house be elected directly or indirectly?

context: Alternatively, or in addition to this practice, the members of an upper house may be <a1_0><b5_0>indirectly<a1_0/> elected<b5_0/> by the <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>government or legislature<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> of the component states, as occurred in the United States prior to 1913, or be actual members or delegates of the state governments, as, for example, is the case in the German Bundesrat and in the Council of the European Union. The lower house of a federal legislature is usually <a2_0><b6_0><b7_0>directly<a2_0/> elected<b7_0/><b6_0/>, with apportionment in proportion to population, although states may sometimes still be guaranteed a certain minimum number of seats.
